body: I don't know about the Android part, but I did confirm that the `./configure --help` outputs are identical modulo the version number.
Please don't remove this blank line

> +checking for struct sockaddr_un... yes

That looks vaguely promising. Is there better UNIX socket support ?
Seems so: https://github.com/libevent/libevent/commit/737d1beb14423dc212b0c53edf536b3172c87571
Can't find anything similar for the HTTP client though.

> Can you mention which Android patches are no-longer required? As if we don't actually want to bump `libevent`, maybe we could move them into depends.

This [patch](https://github.com/greenaddress/bitcoin_ndk/blob/master/0001-fixup.patch) from @greenaddress for missing arc4random_addrandom. It is now handled in upstream.

> This PR would also need to update the `libevent` entry in [doc/dependencies.md](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/dependencies.md).

Good point. Done.

> Which operating systems have you tested building / running Bitcoin Core on with the new libevent?

termux on Android-5 (ndk 20).

<!--a722867cd34abeea1fadc8d60700f111-->

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16916](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16916.html) (WIP QT Android Build by BlockMechanic)
* [#16110](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16110.html) (depends: Add Android NDK support by icota)
